snippet.title: 10 wacky brand voices that have way too much fun on Twitter
snippet.description: There's a fine line to walk when choosing to be weird on Twitter. Here are 10 brand voices that pull it off, pancakes and all.

snippet.title: GNOME 3.10 has resurrected what was once the darling of the Linux desktop
snippet.description: Jack Wallen examines the state of the GNOME 3.10 desktop. His conclusion might surprise you.

snippet.title: CodePaLOUsa 2014: Good software design fundamentals and work/life balance tips
snippet.description: Tony Patton recaps the recent CodePaLOUsa software development conference, which featured sessions about women in IT, Sass, Ember.js, Meteor.js, and much more.

snippet.title: 'BountyHunter shows that you can use the Internet to disrupt anything'
snippet.description: BountyHunter combines crowdsourcing and market research to shake up the competition marketplace for creative professionals.

snippet.title: Build big data adaptability through rapid experimentation
snippet.description: Discover why your organization must experiment with high volume, velocity, and variety for its big data strategy to succeed.

snippet.title: DS9's Chase Masterson on Star Trek, documentary film, and advocacy
snippet.description: In this interview, Chase Masterson recounts fond memories of working on Deep Space Nine, describes some of her other acting, producing, and singing work, and talks about being a me...

snippet.title: Web design themes: Create a vintage look and feel
snippet.description: Ryan Boudreaux illustrates some of the elements that come together to create a vintage, or retro-themed, web design and shares some tips for finding resources and inspiration.

snippet.title: 10 reasons why Linux Mint is the most user-friendly desktop operating system available
snippet.description: Does Linux Mint 12 deliver the ultimate desktop experience? Check out these features and see what you think.

snippet.title: Finally, some actual tools to use in your move to the cloud
snippet.description: We've heard all the hype behind the cloud. Here are some practical tools you can use when you decide to make the move.

snippet.title: TechEd 2011 day 1 keynote: Cloud, devices, music, and magic
snippet.description: John Joyner offers a recap of the TechEd North America 2011 keynote address by Microsoft's Robert Wahbe, in which he focused on cloud computing and devices.
